title: Steam battlestaff

It requires 30 Attack and 30 Magic to wield. The mystic steam staff is an even stronger alternative, providing better melee and magic stat bonuses.

Item ID11787

A steam battlestaff is a steam elemental staff which provides unlimited amounts of water and fire runes as well as the autocast option when equipped. It requires 30 Attack and 30 Magic to wield. The mystic steam staff is an even stronger alternative, providing better melee and magic stat bonuses.

The staff is only obtainable as a potential drop from K'ril Tsutsaroth.

Players can use a steam staff upgrade kit, obtained from Justine's stuff for the Last Shopper Standing, to cosmetically enhance their steam battlestaff, creating a steam battlestaff (or). This only alters its appearance, and becomes untradeable. It can be reverted, but the kit will not be retained.

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
22 September 2021
(update)

The Magic Attack and Defence bonuses of battlestaves have been increased from +10 to +12.

23 January 2014
(update)

Steam battlestaves now properly check for runes in the player's inventory.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • The steam battlestaff is one of four unique boss drops that are not dropped by the respective bodyguards (excluding hilts and pets), the others being Staff of the dead, Saradomin's light and Armadyl crossbow.

[[File:Steam battlestaff detail.png|left|130px]]
A '''steam battlestaff''' is a steam [[Elemental staves|elemental staff]] which provides unlimited amounts of [[Water rune|water]] and [[Fire rune|fire]] runes as well as the [[autocast]] option when equipped. It requires 30 [[Attack]] and 30 [[Magic]] to wield. The [[mystic steam staff]] is an even stronger alternative, providing better melee and magic stat bonuses.

The staff is only obtainable as a potential drop from [[K'ril Tsutsaroth]].

Players can use a [[steam staff upgrade kit]], obtained from [[Justine's stuff for the Last Shopper Standing]], to cosmetically enhance their steam battlestaff, creating a [[steam battlestaff (or)]]. This only alters its appearance, and becomes untradeable. It can be reverted, but the kit will not be retained.
